snippet: At a meeting on Thursday, the Taxi and Limousine Commission also approved ads on the back of printed receipts.
abstract: New York City's Taxi and Limousine Commission approves pilot program that clears the way for at least 30 of the city's 13,237 taxis to have their Taxi TV units replaced with iPads; using technology from San Francisco-based company Square, cab drivers will be able to use the units to accept credit card payments from iPhones, lowering transaction fees for the drivers; TLC also approves proposal to allow advertisements to be printed on the backs of all taxi receipts.
lead_paragraph: At a meeting on Thursday, the Taxi and Limousine Commission also approved ads on the back of printed receipts.
